image.altText: Brisbane 2032 Organising Committee president Andrew Liveris

props.synopsis: The Brisbane 2032 Organising Committee is holding its first meeting of the year amid ongoing debate and disagreement over major venues.

title.children: Brisbane Games chief Andrew Liveris admits venue disagreements 'not a good look'

image.altText: Houses on a hill.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank estimates around 5 per cent of mortgage borrowers are spending more on their repayments and essential living expenses than they earn, and more than 2 per cent could run out of savings by the end of next year.

title.children: Australia's banks safe even as up to 100,000 borrowers risk running out of cash, RBA review finds

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a man imprisoned for life over the brutal murder of his estranged wife have asked to cross-examine witnesses over her alleged rape.

title.children: Kelly Wilkinson's estranged husband's lawyers seek to cross-examine witnesses over rape charges

image.altText: A tall, bald man in a white shirt gets into the back of a police car under escort

props.synopsis: A Queensland man receives a life prison sentence for killing his girlfriend's ex-partner during a "fog of prolific methamphetamine use".

title.children: Man sentenced to life in prison over the stabbing murder of volunteer firefighter

image.altText: a large stadium pictured from above

props.synopsis: The government insists the money will not go to waste and will used on a modest enhancement of the stadium, while Opposition Leader David Crisafulli says he does not support a new stadium for the Games.

title.children: Queensland government spent $6.4 million on now-scrapped Gabba rebuild

image.altText: Solar farm in southern Queensland with glowing sunset.

props.synopsis: Entrepreneur Dick Smith says no country has ever been able to run on renewables, labelling the idea "impossible". What do they experts say?

title.children: We fact checked Dick Smith on whether a country can run entirely on renewables. Here's what we found

image.altText: The back of a young boy's head, looking toward a teacher at the front of a classroom.

props.synopsis: School principals suffer the worst levels of physical violence, threats and bullying in the history of a long-running national survey.

title.children: Machetes, spears and knives: Some principals considering wearing body cameras amid rising school violence

image.altText: A man holds a model of a brain.

props.synopsis: A developmental psychologist says children who spend too much time in front of a screen can develop social and emotional problems well into adolescence.

title.children: Problems with eye contact, attention and emotional regulation linked to high screen time, researcher says

image.altText: A graphic of keli Lane wearing a jacket with barbed wires behind her and a building

props.synopsis: The judge on Keli Lane's trial has since said her case was "circumstantial", but the State Parole Authority denied her parole quoting the 'no body, no parole' laws.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane to remain in jail under NSW's 'no body, no parole' laws

image.altText: A woman smiling with sungalsses in front of the harbour bridge

props.synopsis: Our neighbours across the ditch have been bumped down to number 11 in the Global Happiness Report, but is Australia really happier?

title.children: Australia has outranked New Zealand for happiness. But why?

image.altText: Man wearing headphones in ABC radio studio sitting in front of microphone.

props.synopsis: The ABC Radio Sydney presenter says he's received an "overwhelming" response from listeners following yesterday's candid and characteristically humorous show, and "not to be too macabre, but … the eulogies have been very nice".

title.children: James Valentine buoyed by 'cloud of support and affection' after sharing news of cancer diagnosis

image.altText: a composite image of a lorikeet, miner and magpie

props.synopsis: Last October, 60,000 people spent at least 20 minutes outside to identify the country's bird species and submit their tallies into the Aussie Bird Count app.

title.children: Lorikeet, miner or magpie — what is Australia's most commonly spotted bird?

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

props.synopsis: The police officer who allegedly murdered Sydney couple Jesse Baird and Luke Davies has been removed from the police force by the NSW Commissioner.

title.children: Officer accused of murdering Sydney couple removed from police force

image.altText: A group of people stand in the valley floor surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: It was supposed to be an adventurous day-trip deep into New Zealand's rugged Southern Alps, but on February 12, 1962, the tourists on board the Dragonfly never came home.

title.children: This rugged coastline is the site of mysterious crashes. One expert calls it 'New Zealand's Bermuda Triangle'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks out of a church after a Good Friday service.

props.synopsis: An independent review into protecting LGBT staff and students at religious schools is now complete, but the government's own plans are no clearer.

title.children: PM says religious schools reform 'should be possible', but plans are unclear

image.altText: An Asian woman leans on a brick wall with a stack of books

props.synopsis: Wendy Sara lost her sight at the age of 28, but the Braille House library gives her the ability to see with her imagination. It also teaches others how to read it.

title.children: For every 100 books a sighted child can access, a blind child only has five. This library wants to change that

image.altText: A baby turtle in water with its head poking out of the surface

props.synopsis: From the beach to the world stage, these baby turtles inspire a love for the endangered species after being plucked from their nests at night to be hatched in incubators.

title.children: This natural phenomenon happens 60cm below the beach. Now scientists have found a way to unveil it

image.altText: A woman with her mouth scribbled out and eyes blurred.

props.synopsis: Sophie* came to Australia to pursue a PhD but when her relationship turned violent she felt like she had nowhere to go.

title.children: Being in a foreign country, Sophie didn't know where to go when she left her violent relationship

image.altText: Rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Advocacy group Equality Australia calls the move a "historic step", paying tribute to trailblazing 78ers who took to the streets in protest to make change for the LGBTQ+ community.

title.children: 'We will protect you': NSW bans gay conversion therapy after marathon parliamentary debate

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Donald Trump's jab, a miracle platypus, and another royal controversy

image.altText: Woman in rubble

props.synopsis: The largest missile attack in weeks injured at least 17 and damaged schools, homes and industrial facilities.

title.children: Dozens injured as Russia launches largest missile attack on Kyiv in weeks

image.altText: Woman in front of sign on stone wall.

props.synopsis: Juvenile crime hearings around Queensland hear preventative action needs to start before birth, as police and politicians back a youth justice leader's plan for a less punitive approach.

title.children: Leaders look to cultural healing centres to prevent intergenerational crime cycle

image.altText: Hillcrest Primary School in Devonport

props.synopsis: The castle's operator pleads not guilty to a failure to comply with health and safety duty, and is granted a request for a geotechnical engineer and an inflatables expert examine the castle and the school oval.

title.children: Hillcrest jumping castle to be examined by experts as court tentatively sets trial for September

image.altText: David Cameron in a navy suit.

props.synopsis: British Foreign Secretary David Cameron warns a Chinese blockade of Taiwan would cripple the global economy as he asks Israel to show restraint in Rafah.

title.children: 'Global dashboard flashing red': Former British PM's stark warning of impending conflict

image.altText: Man and woman smile and look at camera.

props.synopsis: The rare snake bite death of a Townsville dad has highlighted a retired catcher's concerns about the risks of untrained handlers trying to relocate the venomous reptiles.

title.children: Father killed by snake bite at childcare centre was 'doing his very best to keep the children safe'

image.altText: Three women in front of Castle Hill, wearing Bring Pink to Townsville T-shirts.

props.synopsis: P!NK is preparing to take the stage in front of more than 60,000 fans in Townsville, injecting nearly $50 million into a city that struggles to attract international artists.

title.children: Townsville group's 12-year campaign to bring pop star P!NK to regional Queensland pays off

image.altText: Two Black men walk towards court house

props.synopsis: Six former law enforcement officers receive their sentences for torturing two black men in an hours-long racially motivated attack in Mississippi.

title.children: 'Goon Squad' former law enforcement officers get decades-sentence for hours-long torture of two Black men

image.altText: A visualisation of an agrihood - a neighbourhood built around both housing and farming.

props.synopsis: Ever wanted to quit the city and run away to start a farm? Welcome to the agrihood, where you can have town living in a rural setting.

title.children: Developer looking to merging homes, farming into 'agrihoods' to ease food, housing pressures

image.altText: The silhouette of buildings are pictured with smoke rising above it.

props.synopsis: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken says he believes talks in Qatar can still reach a Gaza ceasefire agreement, while Israel says it has attacked Hamas gunmen in the enclave's Al-Shifa hospital and evacuated patients.

title.children: Famine looms in Gaza as US secretary of state says ceasefire deal still possible

image.altText: A submarine moves through calm waters

props.synopsis: Almost $5 billion will go to British industry in the next decade to help design and build key parts of Australia's future nuclear-powered submarine fleet that will be constructed in Adelaide.

title.children: China threat justifies AUKUS spend, UK says, as Australia unveils $5b package for British industry

image.altText: Man in a navy blue suit sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: A regional doctor tells an inquiry into healthcare funding that he is spending $30,000 in visa fees to employ enough doctors to run his practice.

title.children: Regional GP spends $30,000 on overseas doctors to fill regional health vacancies, inquiry hears

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower on Friday, even as Wall Street's main indices set fresh records, and Reddit debuted on the market with a massive share price jump. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Banks and energy drag ASX lower, despite Wall St's fresh records overnight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX lower at lunch, dragged down by energy stocks
Up to 100,000 borrowers risk running out of cash to pay mortgages
Swiss central bank kicks off rate cuts

image.altText: Customers walk past an Apple logo inside of an Apple store at Grand Central Station in New York.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit accuses the tech giant of using its "walled garden" design and control of the iPhone to stifle innovation and block competitors from the smartphone market.

title.children: US launches historic lawsuit against Apple, accusing it of crushing competition

image.altText: Reece Walsh looks to his right with a cut under his left eye after the Broncos' NRL loss to the Panthers.

props.synopsis: The Broncos confirm the extent of Reece Walsh's injury in the 34-12 loss to the Panthers, which has forced the club to make alternative plans to get the 21-year-old back home to Brisbane.

title.children: Walsh unable to fly back to Brisbane after suffering facial fracture in Broncos’ loss to Panthers
